sense.def: Alternative Names ji bing 繼病 , transmission disease. Pathological Condition of children under two years of age who, following a second pregnancy of their mother, lose weight to emaciation, are tired and have their hair wither. This was believed to result from their being cursed by the jealousy demon. Tai ping sheng hui fang 太平聖惠方 88: 治小兒鬾病諸方：小兒所有此鬾病，由婦人懷妊之時，有惡神導其腹 中胎妒嫉而制服他小兒令病也。…治小兒生十餘月後，母又有娠，令兒 精神不爽，身體萎瘁，名為鬾病 , “All recipes to cure children’s jealousy-demon disease : Children have this ‘jealousy-demon disease’ when their mother is pregnant [again] and a malign demon causes jealousy against the fetus in the abdomen and then causes the other child to have a disease. … [These recipes] cure children whose mother ten months or more after their birth is pregnant again which causes the child’s essence-spirit to feel unwell, with the result that the entire body fails to function properly. This is called jealousy-demon disease”.
